intro: Pedicularis pseudosteiningeri, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers and its ability to thrive in high-altitude, nutrient-poor environments. Its leaves are usually small and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. The plant's unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
